Detailed Description

Page class reprersents a wiki page. The wiki page consists of elements, which In order to create a page, the page title and text are needed. The text must be the row wiki mark-up. can again have page objects as children. For example, a template parameter could have a template as value. More text parsers could be used, but at this version only the POMExtendedParser is supported. Let's take a look of the following example showing the usage of the POMPage class:

Suppose the the following example page in your wiki named 'Testpage' (shown in wiki mark-up):
{{TemplateName
|Created at=a couple of days ago
|anotherParameter=another value
}}
And here comes text ...
 Now let's use the following test code:

// step 1
$pom = new POMPage('Testpage', join(file('http://<wikihome>/index.php?title=Testpage&action=raw')));
// step 2
$iterator = $pom->getTemplateByTitle("TemplateName")->listIterator();
while($iterator->hasNext()){
// step 3
$template = &$iterator->getNextNodeValueByReference();
// step 4
if ($template->getParameter("Created at") !== NULL){
// step 5
$simpleText = &$template->getParameter("Created at")->getValueByReference()->getSimpleText();
$simpleText = new POMSimpleText("today");
}
}
The steps do the following:
1. One can use the PCPPage and the PageCRUD_Plus package to read the content of a page, but we will use a simple way to access the wiki mark-up in order to concentrate on the actual example.
2. Create an iterator over the templates named 'TemplateName' of the 'Testpage'.
3. For each template in the retrieved list, get a direct reference (access only by value is supported too).
4. Check if a parameter 'Created at' exits.
5. Get a reference to the parameter value and set the new value to a new simple text element ("today").

The object based structure of the page looks like:
page 'Testpage'
   -> child template 'TemplateName'
      -> child template parameter 'Created at'
         -> child page 'temporarypage' (a programmer doesn't see this object directly)
            -> child simple text 'today'

The expected result is:
{{TemplateName
|Created at=today
|anotherParameter=another value
}}
And here comes text ...

See also:
PCPPage

POMElement

Author:
Sergey Chernyshev

Definition at line 284 of file Page.php.

POMPage::addElementAtPosition ( POMElement &$  element,
$  position = -1 
)

Add a an element to the page. The element is added at the specific position in the text. There are several cases covered - the requested position is within:

  • a template => no child is added, but an error is returned.
  • an annotation => there are two subcases - the object to be added is:
    -- an annotation => no child is added, the new annotation replaces the old annotation.
    -- not an annotation => no changes applied.
  • a simple text => there are two subcases - the object to be added is:
    -- also a simple text => the text is added at the requirede position - only the node text is retrieved, the ID is ignored.
    -- not a simple text => the old object is splitted into two new objects with the new object in between.

Parameters:
POMElement $node The child element to be added.
int $position The position in the text, at which the child must be added. If not set, adds the child at the end of the page.
Returns:
True, if operation successful or false, if an error occured.

POMPage::POMPage ( $  title,
$  text,
$  parsers = array('POMExtendedParser') 
)

The constructor of the class. In the constructor the supported element types are set. If an element is added and it is not in the list of the supported elemens, a "Object of class DLList could not be converted to string " exception is thrown.

Parameters:

string $text
string[] $parsers
Returns:
